intro: Silene oligophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in alpine or arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and usually have a reddish or purple tinge, especially along the edges. Silene oligophylla is an herbaceous perennial that produces capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds.
